pullRequest.title: [IOTDB-540] Accelerate Previous Fill
pullRequest.bodyText:
JIRA issue: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IOTDB-540
This PR adds a new Previous Fill implementation
The new version of Previous Fill tries to improve performance in following aspects:

Filter the TsFiles with a more delicate strategy.
Unpack the TsFiles in an inverted manner, to avoid unpacking unnecessary TsFiles into ChunkMetadata.
Avoid unpacking unrelated ChunkMetadatas into PageReader.

update  ttl?

commit.message: refactor previous fill with simple reader
Add update ttl before constructing PreviousFillExecutor

nodes.bodyText:
Suppose the queried time is 100.
seq files: [1,10], [11,20], [200, 300]
unseq files: [30, 40], [41, 50], [51, 60]
It's better not to find the lastSeqChunkMetadata but the last chunkmetadata between seq and unseq.
the pageReader must satisfy this timeFilter, otherwise it will be removed when unpack the ChunkMetadata. This check is not needed.
Is this method used?
Move these to the constructor of PreviousFill, leave empty for the constructReaders. The LinearFill should also be refactored, then this method will be removed

commit.message: integrate previousFill with new tsFile interfaces
Add more integration tests for fill

nodes.bodyText: store context in FIll, remove the parameter in getFillResult
the timeFilter  can not be null
this may produce NullPointerException

use timeseries metadata in previous fill
Modify timeseries usage in previous fill
Fix repeatedly call getChunkMetadataList() in TsFileResource crash bug

nodes.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
               * find the last chunk metadata and unpack all overlapped seq/unseq files
          
          
            
               * find the last TimeseriesMetadata and unpack all overlapped seq/unseq files

commit.message: Fix compile issue after merge with master
change all default fill types to previous fill
Change test case result as the default fill type is changed to previous fill

nodes.bodyText: Suppose two unseq files have the same endTime, they should all be unpacked.
no need to check, pageReaders got from chunkmetadata should satisfy the timeFilter already
no need to remove(0),just traverse is ok. Otherwise, use LinkedList for higher efficiency

What if the currentTime is not at the first index before i call the getLastPairBeforeOrEqualTimestamp method.
So, you should call the resetBatchData() method at the beginning of the method or you should add a javadoc for this method to remind caller that function caller should ensure the current place.
And BTW, i think you can improve your search way like using binary search instead of the linear search way because the time array is in order and are all loaded into memory.

Before you use the statistics info you should use the canUseStatistics() method in the Statistics class to judge whether the statistics can be used. Because may be the chunk has been modified.
Not only here, chunk statistics and page statistics are the same
same as above, remember use canUseStatistics()
with a break, the for loop is not used

commit.message: Fix a potential bug and add more previous fill tests
